basics.name: Pushkar Patil
basics.label: Technology Strategy Consultant
basics.summary: Technology Strategy Consultant capable of architecting and automating high-value data ecosystems that bridge the gap between technical execution and business strategy. Proven ability to manage ~$100M in monthly IT spend and drive multi-million dollar cost savings through cloud optimization and Gen AI innovation. Expert in leveraging Python, AWS, and IBM Apptio to streamline complex financial workflows, with a strong aptitude for building custom software solutions, from microservices to full-stack applications, that accelerate operational efficiency.

purpose.headline: Digital products are not an afterthought. They are the lens through which we view the world. Theyâ€™re the tools I have used for the past 6 years to build the future for my clients.
purpose.description: For the past 6 years, I have focused on one simple thing: bridging the gap between technical execution and business strategy. As a result of this focus, I have developed unique expertise in architecting high-value data ecosystems that accelerate operational efficiency.

about_me: I sit at the intersection of technology and business strategy, translating complex data ecosystems into actionable insights. My journey began in electronics engineering at VJTI, evolving through hands-on data engineering at Deloitte, and refining into strategic leadership with an MBA from IIM Udaipur.

Growing up across diverse cities in Maharashtra - from the bustling streets of Mumbai to the cultural heart of Pune - has shaped my ability to adapt and connect with people from all walks of life. This adaptability is my superpower in navigating the ever-changing tech landscape.

Beyond the desk, I bring the same discipline and competitive spirit that I honed as a National-level skater. Representing my team on the rink taught me resilience, precision, and the value of showing up every single day.

Today, I'm a builder at heart - whether it's architecting cost-saving cloud solutions or creating spaces for unfiltered expression like Madaatih. I believe in the power of automation to not just save costs, but to unlock human potential for deeper innovation.
